Tolkien-related events that took place in 2003.

content.title: January
content.content:
1 - The website Tolkien Gateway is created by Hyarion.
9 - The Brazilian Tolkien society Heren Hyarmen changes its name to "Heren Hyarmeno".

content.title: March
content.content:
11 - At Dawn in Rivendell, the third album of Tolkien Ensemble is released (it was recorded in the previous year). It features recitations by Christopher Lee.
23 - The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers wins two Oscars, out of six nominations, at the 75th Academy Awards.
25 - The first Tolkien Reading Day.

content.title: April
content.content:
1 - J.R.R. Tolkien: His Life and Works is published.
15 - The Art of The Two Towers is published.
30 - J.R.R. Tolkien: A Biography (Greenwood Biographies) by Leslie Ellen Jones is published.

content.title: May
content.content: 5 - Artist Ben Lee dies of Duchenne.

content.title: June
content.content:
5 - Andy Serkis wins an MTV Movie Award, category "Best Animated Character", for his role as Gollum. His immortal acceptance speech would win a Hugo in 2004.
15 - Philip Stone, who voiced Théoden in The Lord of the Rings (1978 film), dies.
16 - British Writers: Classics, Volume II is published.
30 - The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Shadow and Flame is published.

content.title: July
content.content:
10 - Tolkien Thing V.
25-28 - Mythcon 34.
? - Mallorn 41 is published.

content.title: August
content.content: 4 - The Lord of the Rings and Philosophy: One Book to Rule Them All is published.

content.title: September
content.content:
18-21 - Oxonmoot 2003.
22 - The Eleventy-First Birthday Party is held in Frankenmuth, Michigan.
? - The Origins of Tolkien's Middle-earth For Dummies is published.

content.title: October
content.content:
1 - The Gospel According to Tolkien is published.
20 - Tolkien and the Great War is published.
? - Tolkien and C.S. Lewis: The Gift of Friendship is published.

content.title: November
content.content:
4 - The Essential J.R.R. Tolkien Sourcebook is published.
4 - The Lord of the Rings: War of the Ring is released in the USA.
10 - Secret Fire: The Spiritual Vision of J.R.R. Tolkien is published.
11 - The Hobbit (2003 video game) is released in the USA.
14 - Tolkien Through Russian Eyes is published.
18 - The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers Extended Edition is released on DVD.
25 - The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King - Original Motion Picture Soundtrack is released.
26 - Gordon Reid, who provided several voices in The Lord of the Rings radio series, dies.
28 - The Hobbit (2003 video game) is released in Europe.
? - Vinyar Tengwar 45 is published.

content.title: December
content.content:
1 - The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King premieres in Embassy Theatre of New Zealand.
1 - Gollum: How We Made Movie Magic is published.
1 - Tolkien: A Cultural Phenomenon is published.
3 - Actor David Hemmings dies.
17 - The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King is released in USA.
17 - Actor Alan Tilvern dies.
18 - The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King is released in New Zealand.
23 - Parma Eldalamberon 14 is published.

? - 2003 Lord of the Rings Calendar is produced.
? - Middle-earth Calendar 2003 is produced.
? - Parma Nölé 5 is published.
Spring/Summer - Parma Nölé 6 is published.
August/September - Parma Nölé 7 is published.
? - Parma Nölé 8 is published.
? - The Hobbit Calendar 2003 is produced.
? - The Lord of the Rings Fan Club Official Movie Magazine 6 is published.
? - The Lord of the Rings Fan Club Official Movie Magazine 7 is published.
April/May - The Lord of the Rings Fan Club Official Movie Magazine 8 is published.
? - Tolkien in Translation is published.
